page.title: 20JACK FULLER
page.content: Jack Fuller was a rich man and felt sorry for the English soldiers returning from the Napoleanic Wars who didn't have any work to do. Some of the buildings they built now need to be repaired. Brightling Needle has scaffolding around it because the brickwork is crumbling and several miles of wall need attention too. Some rich Americans have given money to make the necessary repairs to these 'follies'. Jack also built a round tower in a patch of woodland surrounded by fields. It use to be hollow but now there is a spiral stair case and a ladder leading to the top. There is a pub called the Fuller's Arms in Brightling with lots of old photographs hanging on the wall. Legend recalls that he is buried sitting at a table with a bottle of wine in his hand - Mad Jack Fuller.
